conbody.p: Select the Assignments tab in the main window (see ), select an assignment from the list, and press the Publish button to initiate publication of that assignment. This will open the assignment publication dialog box.
Elements of the publication dialog box:

row.entry: Календарь для установки даты и времени начала публикации _fixme_ [translate]
Календарь для установки срока выполнения публикации _fixme_ [translate]
List of students to receive the assignment
Remove student from the list button

conbody.p: Задание будет опубликовано в соответствии с выбранной датой и временем начала публикации. По умолчанию выбирается текущее время и дата, но с помощью календаря можно сдвинуть момент публикации на нужный срок вправо по линии времени. До наступления указанного момента публикация будет видна преподавателю и доступна для редактирования, но не будет видна учащимся. С момента наступления указанных даты и времени начала публикации она появится у учащегося в списке назначенных заданий (см. ) при очередном сеансе его работы с модулем Задания через Интернет. _fixme_ [translate]

You can choose one of the three methods for setting the deadline by selecting the appropriate radio button:
Method Allotted time limit
Set date and time From the moment of assignment publication until specified date and time
Set number of days Specific number of days (24 hour periods) from the moment of assignment publication
Set number of hours Specific number of hours from the moment of assignment publication

You can use the Add student and Edit student buttons to add students to the list of assignment recipients or to edit their data. This will open a dialog for adding or editing student data. Student data consists of a mandatory student ID and an optional student screen name. Screen name is how the name of the student will be displayed throughout the assignment.

You can also import a class list to save the hassle of adding students manually. Press the Load class list button to import class list from a Nibelung Class List file (these files have the NCL extension). You will be prompted to select an NCL file. Student list and class in the assignment will be filled in automatically upon successful importation of the class list.
conbody.note: Class list file must have the student ID field filled in for every student in the class.
conbody.p: Press the Save class list button to save the student list into a Nibelung Class List file. This class list can be reused in another assignment prepared with the help of Remote Assignments module, as well as loaded into Dialog Nibelung itself.
conbody.note: An assignment can not be published if any of the students in the list are missing their student IDs (empty fields will be marked with red borders). Assignments also can not be published with an empty student list.
conbody.p: The description and comment fields are optional and serve for informational purposes only.

Press the Publish button to publish the assignment. Assignment status will change to Published. From that moment students will see the assignment upon startup or refresh of their Remote Assignments interfaces and can start working on it. This will also start the clock for the time allotted for the assignment.
Status of the assignment will change from Published to Handed out when particular student actually receives the assignment.
Press the Cancel button to cancel publishing the assignment. This button will close the publication dialog box without saving any modifications to the assignment.
